thread.title: Liverpool's new chief executive was once a foul-mouthed, cigar-smoking South Park character
thread.title_full: Liverpool's new chief executive was once a foul-mouthed, cigar-smoking South Park character

author: Mark Jones
title: Liverpool's new chief executive was once a foul-mouthed, cigar-smoking South Park character
text:
"So come on down to Anfield meet some friends of mine." (Photo: Bloomberg) Share Get Liverpool FC   Could   
Well... this is an odd one. 
Usually when new chief executives are appointed by the big football clubs they are just a suit, and someone that you know must have been successful in business at some point in their careers but you're not really bothered about where or when. 
But then you find out that Liverpool's new chief exec was once on SOUTH PARK. (Photo: Bloomberg) 
That's right. 
As revealed by our friends at the Liverpool Echo , Peter Moore - the boyhood Reds fan who was the EA Sports Chief Competition officer before his new life - was in a 2011 episode of the foul-mouthed, usually hilarious cartoon show in which Cartman and the gang created a video game to help out, er, "crack babies." Yeah. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
Moore doesn't exactly come across very well in the cartoon, but he doesn't seem to mind all that all much. 
At one point, when being told by the South Park boys that they want to use the money to help others, Moore's character "Mr Peters" says: 
"Oh well ... f*** em! And f*** you too! I p*** in your faces. Now let's part with that ol' EA Sports saying: Get the f*** outta my building!" Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
But Moore himself referenced that in a speech at an EA Sports conference later shortly afterwards, saying: 
"Before I go I'd like to leave you with that good ol EA Sport saying. Get the ... No I can't do that." 
Seems like a good guy. 
He definitely won't kill Kenny (Dalglish). poll loading Will Liverpool finish in the top four? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
